body.p: This tutorial demonstrates how to set up Remote Desktop access to new Windows instances running in HP Helion OpenStack Since the instances are running full versions of Windows, you must connect to them using Remote Desktop rather than SSH.
The steps needed to do this are as follows:

li.xref: Add the RDP security group to the instance
Retrieve the Windows instance password (Public Cloud)
Retrieve the Windows instance password (Helion OpenStack)

ol.li: In the Horizon console, select Project, Access & Security.
Select Security Groups if it is not already selected.
Give the security group an appropriate name (such as cluster1-rdp), and an appropriate description (sucn as Remote Desktop Access).

section.title: Add the RDP security group to the instance

ol.li: Select Project, Instances. In the Actions column for your instance, select Edit Security Groups from the pull-down.
Click the + button next to the RDP security group you created to add it to the instance. Click Save.

section.title: Retrieve the Windows instance password (Public Cloud)

ol.li: Select Project, Instances. In the Actions column for you instance, select Retrieve Windows Password.

In the Retrieve Windows Password page, copy and paste the contents of your private key (pem) file. If you created the key with a password, provide the password as well. Click Retrieve Windows Password.
The Windows password will be displayed.
